page.title: 07Whaddon.
page.content: The village of Whaddon is just outside the southern boundary of Gloucester. It is part of the civil parish of Brookthorpe-with-Whaddon, and, since 1982, of the ecclesiastical parish of St. George (in Tuffley). The church, dedicated to St. Margaret probably dates from 1150-1200. Its font dates from the 14th century. The East window by Ninian Comper is "signed" with a sprig of wild straw- berry. Wynstones School, in the former Manor House, is founded on the principles of Rudolf Steiner. It emphasises the importance of presenting lessons as artistically as possible. Most of the pupils are day children but there are also 50-60 boarders.There is no head- teacher:the body of teachers takes all the decisions of the school.
